summary: This is an email from a prosecutor to Judge Nathan's chambers submitting proposed jury instructions (Request to Charge) and a verdict sheet for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. It indicates the government will file redacted versions publicly and that the defense seeks to seal an exhibit.

events.title: Preparation of Trial Documents
events.description: The government finalizes and submits its proposed jury instructions (Request to Charge) and a verdict sheet for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

keyFacts: This document is a procedural email from the prosecution to the court in the case of US v. Ghislaine Maxwell.
The government submitted an unredacted Request to Charge (jury instructions) and a verdict sheet on November 3-4, 2021.
The government intended to file redacted versions of these documents publicly on the court's electronic filing system (ECF).
The defense sought to seal 'Exhibit A' to the Request to Charge.
The correspondence shows the trial was in its final stages, with the parties preparing for jury deliberations.
